byline.contributor: Al Baker, Alexander Burns and Nate Schweber contributed reporting. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and DANIEL E. SLOTNIK

abstract: Kevin Downing, who fatally shot security guard Idrissa Camara at federal building in SoHo and then killed himself, had long history of misfortune; friends and associates are nevertheless shocked at crime committed by Columbia-trained economist and Army veteran.
lead_paragraph: The foundations of Kevin Downing’s life had begun to crumble long before he opened fire at a federal building in Manhattan on Friday.

headline.main: Unraveling of Gunman Began Long Before Killing a Guard and Himself in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Unraveling of Gunman Began Long Before Killing a Guard and Himself

snippet: The foundations of Kevin Downing’s life had begun to crumble long before he opened fire at a federal building in Manhattan on Friday.
